info.title: Joomla Web Services API
info.description:
Joomla Web Services for Joomla 4+

Authentication is done using a Joomla API Token. To get the token, go to the user profile in your Joomla installation and activate and copy the API key. 

## Videos

[YouTube playlist about Joomla Web Services / APIs](https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLsg93PS_2NeL850YZFlAi1Eb7hwxETNkX)

get.description: Get a list of Banners in the Joomla site.

post.description: Add a Banner to the Joomla site.

get.description: Get the Banner with a specific banner_id.

delete.description: Delete the Banner with a specific banner_id.

patch.description: Update the Banner with a specific banner_id.

get.description: Get a list of Banners Clients in the Joomla site.

post.description: Add a new Banners Client to the Joomla site.

contact.description: The name of the contact person for this client.

extrainfo.example: Some extra info about this Banners Client.

value.extrainfo: Some extra info about this Banners Client.
value.name: Name of client

get.description: Get the Banners Client with a specific client_id.

delete.description: Delete the Banners Client with a specific client_id.

patch.description: Update the Banners Client with a specific client_id.

contact.description: The name of the contact person for this client.

email.description: The e-mail address of the banner client.

get.description: Get a list of Banners Categories

post.description: Add a Banners Category to the Joomla site.

get.description: Get the Banners Category with a specific category_id.

delete.description: Delete the Banners Category with a specific category_id.

patch.description: Delete the Banners Category with a specific category_id.

get.description: List the Banners Content History for a specific banner_id.

delete.description: Delete the Banners Content History for a specific banner_id.

patch.description: Keep the Banners Version for a specific version_id.

get.description:
Get a list of configured Media Adapters. Adapters define storage backends and root paths for media files. For examples of how to use Media Adapters, please refer to

[https://github.com/joomla/joomla-cms/blob/6.0-dev/tests/System/integration/api/com_media/Adapters.cy.js](https://github.com/joomla/joomla-cms/blob/6.0-dev/tests/System/integration/api/com_media/Adapters.cy.js)
Get the Media Adapter with a specific adapter_id.
Get a list of media files. This only gives back the files in the files-directory. Do you need some 'path' request variable?

200.description: Media files listed successfully. Todo: check when path is to single file

post.description: Add a (Base64-encoded) media file to the Joomla site.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Directory path including adapter prefix (e.g. local-images:/test/test.png).

get.description: Get a file in a directory. When the path ends with a slash ('/'), list the items in the directory.

200.description: Media file or directory listing returned successfully.

404.description: Media file or directory not found.

delete.description: Delete the media file at the given path.

204.description: Media file deleted successfully, but no content is returned

patch.description: Update an existing media file by sending new Base64-encoded content.

self.description: Canonical URL of the current resource.

content.description:
Base64-encoded file content. Present in POST/PATCH responses, not returned by GET.

TODO: Confirm whether content inclusion can be toggled via query parameters.

total-pages.description: Total number of pages available for the current listing.

MediaFileCollectionResponse.description: Response returned when a directory path (ending with '/') is requested.

MediaFileResponse.description: Response returned when a single media file is requested.

MediaFileUploadRequest.description: No mime-type property in Joomla file upload, nor file-size

content.description:
Base64-encoded file bytes (RFC 4648). For examples of how to use Media Files, please refer to

[https://github.com/joomla/joomla-cms/blob/6.0-dev/tests/System/integration/api/com_media/Files.cy.js](https://github.com/joomla/joomla-cms/blob/6.0-dev/tests/System/integration/api/com_media/Files.cy.js)

provider_id.description: Identifier of the storage provider backing this adapter (e.g. 'local').

path.description: Root path of the adapter, including adapter prefix (e.g. local-images:/).

MediaAdapterCollectionResponse.description: Response returned when listing available media adapters.

MediaAdapterResponse.description: Response returned when retrieving a single media adapter.
